page.title: 15BACKWELL GENERAL DESCRIPTION
page.content: In the past, Backwell had many mine_ shafts, as coal reserves were large. There were a lot of miners' cottages, all together in terraces. Coal was soon exhausted though, and the mine_ shafts fell derelict. Backwell had many orchards and some survive today. A few old wells can still be seen. Backwell is quite large now. There are lots of footpaths and the fields are arable or pasture. A railway line runs through the countryside. There is a lake and along the lanes there are hedges and trees. Altogether Backwell's countryside is peaceful. Backwell could become smaller soon, because houses in nearby Nailsea are being built and spreading towards Backwell. More people will enter the area bringing children. A new school will have to be built and a new name needed.Backwell's future is uncertain.
